title: Help with these two European newspaper titles: blackletter mastheads of Aftenposten and FAZ - custom
content:
Greetings type enthusiasts. On a recent trip to Europe I was browsing the newsstands and came across these two lovely typefaces. I thought they were great. I'd like to buy them/download them if possible for my own uses and I was hoping someone out there could help me identify them. Much thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012030147/http:/typophile.com/files/1_32.jpg) | 41.11 KB |
| [2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012030147/http:/typophile.com/files/2_31.jpg) | 39.16 KB |
author: cky

comments.content: I don’t think that there is an exact match for the masthead of »Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung« (FAZ). You might browse Dieter Steffmann’s [collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012030147/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/index.htm) for a start. For the headlines within the paper, FAZ employed a special version of Fette Gotisch called »FAZ Fraktur« made by [URW](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012030147/http:/www.urwpp.de/deutsch/home.html), which unfortunately is not used anymore since about two years.
That's excellent that's for those links. Does anyone have an idea of what the Aftenposten font could be?

Aftenposten isn’t a font either. Newspaper masthead almost always are custom designed.  
I browsed through various blackletter specimen, but couldn’t find anything similar. The round e is pretty special, and so is the A.
